content.text:
I'll start by exploring the codebase to understand its structure and get familiar with the project.

<function_calls>
<invoke name="Read">
<parameter name="file_path">/Users/patrick/workingdir/familiar/CLAUDE.md</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<result>
# Familiar

A local, high-performance AI agent desktop app built with Tauri, Go backend, and React UI.

## Tech Stack

- **Desktop**: Tauri (Rust) with React 19 + TypeScript frontend
- **Backend**: Go server (runs as Tauri sidecar)
- **UI**: Vite, Tailwind CSS, TanStack Query
- **Testing**: Vitest (unit), Playwright (e2e), Go test

## Essential Commands

All commands run via `make` from the project root:

```bash
# Setup & Run
make setup          # Install all dependencies
make run            # Start dev server (builds sidecar + runs tauri dev)
make build          # Production build

# Testing
make test           # Run all tests (backend + UI + e2e)
make test-backend   # Go tests only
make test-ui        # Vitest UI tests only
make test-e2e       # Playwright e2e tests

# Code Quality
make lint           # Go vet
make fmt            # Go fmt

# Other
make clean          # Remove build artifacts
make website-dev    # Run website dev server
```

## Project Structure

```
packages/
  desktop/          # Tauri desktop app
    src-tauri/      # Rust/Tauri code
    ui/             # React frontend (Vite)
      src/          # React components, hooks, etc.
      e2e/          # Playwright tests
  go-backend/       # Go server (cmd/server)
  website/          # Marketing website
```

## Key Files

- `Makefile` - All build/test commands
- `.env` - Environment variables (not committed)

## Guidelines

- Run `make test` before committing changes
- Go backend runs on port 18080 during development
- NEVER RUN DESTRUCTIVE GIT COMMANDS.
</result>

Now I have a good overview of the project structure. This is "Familiar", a local AI agent desktop app built with:

- **Tauri** (Rust) for the desktop shell
- **Go backend** running as a sidecar
- **React 19 + TypeScript** frontend with Vite
- **Tailwind CSS** for styling
- **TanStack Query** for data fetching

The project structure includes:
- `/packages/desktop/` - The Tauri desktop app with React UI
- `/packages/go-backend/` - The Go server with internal packages for auth, config, database, inference, models, routes, and server
- `/packages/shared/` - Shared code between packages
- `/packages/website/` - Marketing website

I'm now warmed up and ready to help with any specific task or question about this codebase. What would you like me to explore or plan?
